snippet: Americans lose billions of dollars every year repaying small loans to payday lenders. Why not let the banks help them out?
abstract: Op-Ed article by professor Frederick Wherry implores Congress to lift regulations preventing banks from entering small loan market; cites payday lenders' onerous annual interest rates, which range from 391 to 521 percent; argues banks already have infrastructure as well as access to collateral in form of borrower's checking accounts.
lead_paragraph: Americans lose billions of dollars every year repaying small loans to payday lenders. Why not let the banks help them out?

headline.main: Payday Loans Cost the Poor Billions, and There’s an Easy Fix
